thought: The about us page is online and functional, as indicated by the status code 200. Now I will extract the text from the about us page to determine if the company information is genuine.
observation: Your shopping cart is empty! Thousand  Mile is simply the journey you are on. It could be your next trail, the perfect wave or a campfire with friends. The items we offer accompany you on that journey. We make clothing that is built to last, comfortable and looks great, all manufactured right here in the USA.   Our company is unique because we build quality clothing that bridges the gap between style, comfort, performance and durability. Unlike other apparel manufacturers whose customers reflect their brand, we like to think that our products reflect our customers. Ultimately, we make clothing that makes sense to you.   The first step in our crossing begins with Campcloth™, a remarkably breathable 100% cotton fabric and one of our favorite building blocks. It is tough as nails and pure heaven to your skin. We also manufacture an excellent selection of organic and jersey cotton products along with a line of professional swimwear.  We measure our success by the quality of our goods and your satisfaction, so it's important that we hear from you. Give us a shout at 800-786-7577 or send us your comments.  Let your journey begin where you stand now.  We look forward to roaming with you! Chris HuberOwner

thought: The WHOIS information shows that the domain name is registered to an individual with an address in San Diego, California, has been registered since 1998, and is set to expire in 2026. The contact information includes a phone and fax number that matches the numbers listed on the website, which suggests that the site is operated by a legitimate entity. The domain status being clientTransferProhibited is a common security measure to prevent unauthorized transfers. The fact that the domain has been registered for a long time and the consistency of contact information lend credibility to the site. Given the evidence from the WHOIS data, the privacy policy details, and the lack of alarming signs from the website's content, it does not seem to be a fraudulent site based on the characteristics provided. The future copyright date could be a simple oversight, and while the last modification date on the privacy policy is from 2018, this alone does not indicate fraud. I now know the final answer. The website https://www.thousandmile.com/ does not appear to be a fraudulent site.

observation.reason: The website has a long-standing domain registration since 1998 with consistent contact details a comprehensive privacy policy and no evident characteristics of a fraudulent site based on the criteria provided.
